content.description: About 15 ft or so right of the Jabba hand crack, aim for the first bolt.  Three more protect the cruxy upper parts, if you can find them in the lichen.
content.protection: This is really a sport route with a 'trad' portion getting to the first bolt.  Bring a brush for the lichen.

content.description: An obviously left slanting crack just right of the overhangs leads to some flakes.  Above the flakes the original route goes left up a little ramp covered with lichen (5.6 if you can find it).  A new bolt protects a direct finish straight up which is lichen free but probably 5.9- at the least.

A steep slab with several routes on it just off the ridge trail with a fair amount of lichen and a south facing exposure.  Approach carefully via the slab and hillside just below the overhang ('3rd class') or rappel down from the bolts at the top.  This latter option also involves a bit of scrambling down a slab.  These bolts can also be used to top rope most of the routes.
